subsc: Secondary education,Central government administration,Sub-national government administration,Tertiary education
trustfund:
TF024852-SOCIAL SECTORS UNIT IN LA PAZ,TF023940-PORTUGUESE CTF (ICEP),TF036557-COLOMBIA - SECONDARY EDUCATION,
            RURAL EDUCATION,TF032383-LAC REGION - EDUCATION;HEATLH

abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the project is assessed
            as satisfactory, with likely sustainability, and
            institutional development impacts. However, both
            performances by the Bank, and Borrower are rated as
            moderately satisfactory, given the failure to secure
            government support to quality interventions, causing
            unnecessary delays in implementation, and, due to
            performance difficulties in financial, legal, and activities
            of the Social Investment Fund, respectively. Lessons
            highlight the need to establish early on, an evaluation
            baseline; the importance of focusing on the pedagogical
            aspects of the project; the need to translate the concept of
            municipal education, and institutional school improvement
            plans as defined by legislation, into operational
            instruments; the need for adequate financial resources; and,
            the importance of working directly with local authorities.
            Moreover, lessons demonstrated the potential effectiveness
            of demand-side subsidies, showing increased coverage, and
            improved equity through the private sector, without reducing
            quality. And, the increased awareness of the importance of
            education, translated into increased investments for the
            sector, i.e., government agencies, and municipalities alike
            consider education a high priority in their development
            plans. However, institutional autonomy still needs
            definition, and promotion.
